headline: Classic Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A creamy and delicious pasta dish made with eggs, cheese, pancetta, and pepper. Ready in just 20 minutes.

sources.alt: A delicious plate of Spaghetti Carbonara

instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil and cook spaghetti according to package directions.
While pasta cooks, heat a large skillet over medium heat and cook pancetta until crispy.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, grated cheeses, and black pepper.
Drain pasta, reserving 1 cup of pasta water.
Add hot pasta to the skillet with pancetta and remove from heat.
Quickly stir in the egg mixture, adding pasta water gradually to create a creamy sauce.
Serve immediately with extra cheese and black pepper.

headline: Mastering Interactive Popovers in Modern Web Design
subheadline: A comprehensive guide to creating accessible and engaging popover experiences
summary: Learn how to implement interactive popovers that enhance user experience without compromising accessibility. This guide covers best practices, implementation patterns, and real-world examples.

sources.alt: Interactive popover demonstration on a modern web interface

content.text:
Interactive popovers have become a cornerstone of modern web design, providing contextual information and actions without disrupting the user's flow. In this comprehensive guide, we'll explore the principles behind effective popover design and implementation.

From accessibility considerations to performance optimization, we'll cover everything you need to know to create popovers that delight users and meet modern web standards.

popover.content:
More Details

This is a small article inside a popover.

It can contain any HTML content.

This demonstrates the flexibility of the popover component.

Click the close button to dismiss.

summary: The best way to predict the future is to invent it.

text.headline: What is Quantum Computing?
text.text: Quantum computing uses quantum bits to perform computations much faster than classical computers for certain problems.

text.headline: When will it be mainstream?
text.text: Experts predict quantum computers will become more widely available within the next decade.

text.headline: 1980s
text.text: Theoretical foundations of quantum computing are established.
Peter Shor develops Shor's algorithm, showing quantum computers can factor large numbers efficiently.

text.headline: 2020s
text.text: Quantum computers achieve quantum supremacy on specific tasks.

headline: Generic Content Card
summary: The Content Card is a versatile component that renders all common fields without type-specific data. Use it for simple content that doesn't fit a specific card type.

content.text: This card demonstrates the base content structure shared by all card types. It includes media, headlines, summary text, author attribution, engagement metrics, tags, and action buttons.

headline: Minimal Content Display
summary: Sometimes you just need a simple card without the complexity of specialized schemas. The content card provides exactly that.

headline: Text-Only Content Card
summary: This example shows a content card with no media - just pure text content. Perfect for quotes, announcements, or simple text blocks.

content.text:
The content card adapts gracefully when media is not provided. It focuses on the textual content while maintaining proper semantic structure and optional Schema.org markup.

Use this approach when visuals aren't necessary or when you want to draw attention to the written content.
